DOC.detailed_description: Objective An influential model cortical organization proposes primate visual system divide two functionally distinct pathway ( Ungerleider & Mishkin , 1982 ) . The ventral visual pathway , project occipital cortex ventral temporal cortex , principally use object recognition identification . The dorsal pathway , project occipital cortex parietal cortex , principally use locate position object visual field action planning ( Milner & Goodale , 1995 ; Kravitz et al. , 2011 ) . In proposed series experiment investigate neural representation ventral dorsal pathway contribute range cognitive task include object scene recognition , attentional selection face processing . These experiment principally use transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) combination functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) . TMS provide unique experimental tool study human cognitive function use transiently safely disrupt neural processing target cortical region subject perform concurrent behavioral task depend operation region . Furthermore TMS combine neuroimaging technique fMRI examine remote effect induce neural disruption task-dependent region distribute across cortex . We plan use TMS address unanswered question concern functioning distribute neural network different category object recognition attention network human brain .
